physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Decreased motion of the left hip, most marked in rotation and abduction; anterior groin pain with internal and external rotation maneuvers; lateral hip pain with extremes of flexion.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No changes in the radiographic appearance of the lesions were noted after initial treatment.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Physical examination unremarkable except for obesity; full, painless passive range of motion of hips.
Worsening left groin pain limited his activity; painful, limited internal rotation of left hip (20 degrees).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The left osteochondritis dissecans lesion was found to be larger than the right with likely separation.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Right antalgic gait and limited hip motion bilaterally; flexion 80 degrees bilaterally; abduction 35 degrees on the right and 45 degrees on the left.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Left hip pain decreased while right hip pain worsened.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Limited passive motion of the right hip and pain with internal rotation; flexion 100 degrees; abduction 20 degrees; adduction 0 degrees; external rotation 30 degrees; internal rotation 0 degrees.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Substantial functional limitations due to right hip pain.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Increasing activity-related pain localized to the anterior part of the left hip; MRI showed large femoral head osteochondral lesion with labral tears.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Substantial decrease in the activity-related left hip pain after follow-up treatment.
